The spirit manifests physically in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. The spirit uses the {@creature Insect Drone|insectopia} stat block below. You can have only one spirit at a time and can't summon another one while your spirit is present. A spirit disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as a free action. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

When you summon a spirit, you determine its appearance and choose Bulwark Beetle, Stinger Wasp, Trap Spider, or Dew Fly. The spirit physically resembles your choice of insect drone, which also determines some of the traits in its stat block.

The spirit is friendly to you and your companions. In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. You can telepathically issue commands to it while on the same plane of existence and it obeys any command that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it defends itself but otherwise takes no action. The spirit cannot use reactions if not specified otherwise.
You can summon and control an additional spirit at 7th and 11th level. You cannot summon a type of drone you already control.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Mind
entries: At 7th level, you can use an action to mark a creature within 90 feet of you with a psychic tag for 1 minute. Any damage dealt by your weapon attacks or your drones to the marked creature changes its damage type to psychic.
You need to finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Swarm
entries: At 11th level, your drones gain an additional action you can use while controlling them, as detailed in the Insect Drone stat block.
Furthermore, if your drones are forced to make a saving throw, they can use your modifiers instead.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: At 15th level, your psychic connection to the far realm allows you to summon stronger spirits. When summoning a spirit you now choose either Adamantine Beetle, Executioner Wasp, Hunter Spider, or Vitality Fly. They retain all the abilities of their previous forms in addition to the abilities detailed in the Evolved Drones table below.

entries.caption: Evolved Drones
rows: The AC of the beetle increases + your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, when a creature moves into 5 feet of the beetle, it can use a reaction to make a pincer attack against the creature.
The wasps flying movement speed is increased by 10 feet. Additionally, when using its sting action to attack a creature, it can attack again using its bonus action.
The spider can now trap up to three creatures in range using its Web Shot action. Additionally, the range of Web Shot is increased to 60 feet.
The range of Cloud of Vitality is increased to 30 feet and the amount of healing done increased by {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: The Mimic
entries: Those Rogues who take it upon themselves to embody the Mimic archetype take after the monstrosities they are named for. With a suite of abilities involving mimicry of both form and skill, Mimic Rogues are not only powerful friends, but dangerous foes. They use an innate magically ability, that allows their shadow to shape and form into copies of what they can perceive.

subclassFeature.name: Mimicry
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to copy the skills of another creature. When rolling a skill or ability check you can instead choose a creature within 30 feet of you and roll using its statistics for the ability or skill. You can only copy a creature's statistics if you know the creature well, having spend at least 1 hour observing the creature. You can't use this ability on saving throws.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Imitate
entries: Also starting at 3rd level, when a creature you can see is using an action or bonus action or a triggered ability, such as an Imp's polymorph or a wolf's pack tactics, you can use your reaction to attempt mimic it. If the creature is unwilling, you need to succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against a DC equal to 10 + the targets level or challenge rating to copy the ability. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency modifier and need to finish a long rest to regain expended uses.
You can only copy one feature at a time and only from a creature with a CR or level equal to your rogue level divided by 3 (rounded down).
You gain the benefits of the copied ability until the end of your next turn or until you use it once.
You can't imitate features that are inherent to a magic item. You can't mimic spells or a creatures spellcasting ability.

subclassFeature.name: Impersonation
entries: At 9th level, you can perfectly impersonate another humanoid, taking on its form. You need to spend at least one hour studying a small or medium humanoid you want to impersonate. After that, you can use an action to polymorph into the humanoid. You can use this feature twice. You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You can only impersonate a creature with a CR or class level equal or lower to your rogue level.

You can impersonate a creature for a number of hours equal to half your rogue level (rounded down). You then revert to your normal form unless you expend another use of this feature. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit point, or die.

You can remember only one impersonation at a time. You can change your impersonation by studying another humanoid for another hour, gaining the new form and loosing the old. When you reach 13th level you remember an additional impersonation.
While you are impersonating a creature, the following rules apply:

items: You look indiscernible to the creature you impersonate. If you rouse suspicion, or if a wary creature suspects something is amiss, you have advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check you make to avoid detection.

You retain your game statistics, hit points and Hit Dice, alignment, personality, all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the its bonus is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.

You can't cast spells. Impersonating doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as {@spell call lightning}, that you've already cast.
The benefits of any features from your class, race, or other source are replaced by the features of the creature you are impersonating.

You retain all of your equipment, and do not gain any equipment the impersonated creature owns. However, your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

subclassFeature.name: Infiltration
entries: At 13th level, you can infiltrate a creatures mind, controlling their any move. Using an action you can touch a creature and force it to make an Intelligence saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you and follows each of your spoken commands to the best of its abilities. On a success, the creature isn't charmed and is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

While a creature is {@condition charmed} by you through this feature, you can't use bonus actions or reactions. Furthermore, you see through the charmed creatures eyes and hear what it hears, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the creature has. During this time, you are {@condition deaf} and {@condition blind} with regard to your own senses. While the creature is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically.
The creature can make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it succeeds it is no longer charmed by you.
You need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect clone
entries: At 17th level, you can use an action creating a perfect clone of yourself out of your shadow. The clone has the same shape and size as you, as well as the same statistics, features, and abilities (except the abilities gained from this archetype), but only halve of your current hit points. The clone doesn't gain your spellcasting ability or spells.
The clone is created with copies of your equipped weapons and armor, but otherwise doesn't have access to your equipment.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the clone up to your movement speed to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you. It can then immediately use an action.
The clone lasts for 10 minutes or if it drops to 0 hit points. You need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: The Leech
entries: While other sorcerous bloodlines have an overabundance of arcane energy, Leeches are the exact opposite. They are irregularities in the Weave, points were no arcane energy exist and in turn is sucked into. How you have become this singularity for magic is unknown, but it makes you into a bane for anything magical.
Many military organizations gladly take up these leeches into their ranks, training them to be used as efficient weapons against any spellcaster that would otherwise prove difficult to subdue.

subclassFeature.name: Magician's Bane
entries: Starting at 1st level, you are drawn to magic like a shark towards blood. You can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Sundering Shield
entries: Also at 1st level, when you use your innate magic to cast a spell, you can leech on some of the spells magic to protect yourself. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can create a shielding aura on yourself that lasts until you finish a short or long rest. The shield has hit points equal to your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. Whenever you take damage, the shield takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the shield to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. The shield has resistance against damage dealt by spells.
You need to finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Disruptive Mark
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can disrupt the concentration of spellcasters. On your turn, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and place a disruptive mark on it. For the next minute, while the marked creature is within 30 feet of you, you gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever the creature casts a spell, it must first succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to maintain concentration. On a failed save, the casting is disrupted, the spell fails, and the spellslots are wasted.

Whenever the creature starts its turn while concentrating on a spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to maintain concentration. On a failed save, it loses concentration on the spell.

entries: You can mark only one creature with your disruptive mark at any given time.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Nullzone
entries: At 14th level, your presence alone is disruptive for magical effects. If you are the target of a damaging spell effect cast by a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spells level (a minimum of 1) and halve the damage the spell would deal to any creature affected by it.

subclassFeature.name: Overpower
entries: At 18th level, you can cast the {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} spells at 3rd level against the target of your disruptive mark without expending spell slots. If the marked creature is within 30 feet of you, you have advantage on the spellcasting ability check for these spells. You can cast both spells at a higher level by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the level of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Wurm lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Wurm Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water}, {@spell stinking cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Resilience
entries: At 1st level, you gain a bonus action that you can use on each of your turns to gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level + your proficiency bonus, replacing any temporary hit points you already have.

Additionally, starting at 10th level, as part of this bonus action, you can spend hit dice to add to this temporary HP. The additional temporary hit points equal the number you roll on your hit dice, plus your proficiency bonus. You can spend a number of Hit Dice at once equal to half your level rounded up.
Furthermore, you gain resistance to acid damage and proficiency with shields and heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Spawn of the Wurm
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack you can summon a leech to attach itself to the creature. The leech is a tiny beast with AC 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the leech can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action. A leech that dealt 24 points of damage falls of the creature skin and dies, dealing no further damage to the creature.

At the start of each of the creature's turns, the leech deals {@dice 1d4} points of piercing damage to it and you regain hit points equal to the amount of piercing damage dealt. You can create a number of leeches equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all uses of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Insatiable
entries: Starting at 10th level, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you regains hit points through a spell or other magical effect, you can use a reaction to regain hit points equal to halve the healing done.
Furthermore, you are immune to any disease and poison damage, as well as the {@condition poisoned} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Consume
entries: At 14th level, you can make your insatiable hunger tangible and absorb the life force of creatures around you. Each creature within a 10-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Sonomancy
entries: While bards use enchanting melodies to cast their tantalizing spells, the wizards from the school of sonomancy look at sounds in a more scientific way. The sounds these wizards create aren't meant to be beautiful to listen to, but practical. They use their arcane abilities to creating vibrating Sound Weapons, stop projectiles in mid air, or to cast their spells without the need for vocal components. Mages of this school are often found in battle and many of them are battle-hardened veterans. Many foes of such wizards only hear a faint hum before they realise that they've been stabbed by a vibrating dagger.

subclassFeature.name: Channeling Sound
entries: When you select this school at 2nd level, you gain proficiency with one instrument of your choice and you can use that instrument as a spellcasting focus.
Furthermore, as you learn to preemptively shield yourself against forceful sounds, you gain resistance to thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sound Weapons
entries: Starting at 2nd level when you choose this school, you learn how to control weapons with the vibrations of your magic. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that has the light property. The weapon becomes your Sound Weapon. You can also transform a magic weapon into your sound weapon.

Using a bonus action, you can make your sound weapon vibrate, letting it float in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you for 1 minute. When you animate your sound weapon in this way, you can immediately make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the sound weapon. When attacking with your sound weapon in this way, it deals thunder damage instead of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Should the weapon have any additional effects, they apply as if you would be wielding or attacking with it normally. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

You can catch your sound weapon when it is within 5 feet of you and stop the vibrations as a free action. If you fall unconscious, your sound weapon drops on the ground in the space it is floating in.
You can use this feature to let your sound weapon float twice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Vibration
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can protect yourself from attacks by letting the air around you vibrate. When a creature hits you with a ranged weapon attack or ranged spell attack, you can use your reaction to block the attack from hitting you. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Hearing
entries: Starting at 10th level, you gain the ability to distinguish sounds perfectly and your mastery of vibrations reaches new heights. You can cast all your spells without requiring vocal components.
Additionally, you gain advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and you gain blindsight within 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Sound Weapon
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can create an additional weapon and make it your Sound Weapon. Using your bonus action you can make both sound weapons vibrate, as well as move each of your Sound Weapons up to 20 feet and attack with both individually.

optionalfeature.name: Floating Weapon
entries: By using a bonus action to speak a command word, the weapon starts to float in the air in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the wielder.

As a bonus action on the wielders turn, they can move the weapon up to 20 feet and make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon using your spell-attack modifier. On a hit, the weapon deals damage equal to the weapons damage die + your Intelligence modifier.
The weapon can return to the wielders hand by using a bonus action while the weapon is within 5 feet of them.

optionalfeature.name: Periapt of Poison Immunity
entries: While wearing this pendant, the creature has immunity to poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Whip of Ensnaring
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder of this weapon hits a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll, they can expend 1 charge to ensnare their target. The creature has succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC, or become restrained. The wielder can't attack with the whip as long as it is restraining a creature. The creature can use their action to repeat their saving throw to break free from the whip.
The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious
entries: You grow gills on your neck. You can breathe air and water.

optionalfeature.name: Avoidance
entries: The mutagens quicken your reflexes. If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Bioluminescent
entries: A part of your body grows translucent and fluorescent. You can use a bonus action to illuminate a body part of yourself, shedding bright light in a 20-foor area, and 20 feet of dim light after that.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Your senses heighten drastically when you smell the scent of fresh blood. You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has less than half its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Camouflage
entries: Your skin makes you blend into your surroundings. You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when hiding in natural terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Dive Attack
entries: While flying you can strike with the precision of an eagle. If you are flying and dive at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Echolocation
entries: You can emit high pitched sounds to get a picture of your surroundings. You gain blindsight in a 20 ft. radius. You can't use it while deafened.

optionalfeature.name: Flyby
entries: You fly too quick for enemies to strike you. You don't provoke opportunity attacks when you fly out an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: You gain the senses of a masterful predator. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Weapons
entries: Your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You gain a natural weapon, such as claws, fangs or spikes, that deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You can use your pack to hunt down your pray. You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous Attacks
entries: You produce a lethal poison, you inject through striking your foes. When you hit a creature with your natural weapon, the target must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + Proficiency + Wisdom Modifier, taking 5 ({@dice 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save and the creature is poisoned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes only halve the damage and isn't poisoned.

optionalfeature.name: Rampage
entries: The rush of a kill quickens your movements. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you can take a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a melee weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless
entries: Your animalistic endurance keeps you from fainting. Once per short or long rest, if you take 10 damage or less that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you are reduced to 1 hit point instead.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Climb
entries: Your hands grow small spines that you can use to climb. You gain an additional climbing speed of 30 feet and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Standing Leap
entries: The muscles in you legs grow insanely strong. Your long jump is up to 15 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Sure-footed
entries: You gain the balance of a mountain goat. You have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Webbed Limps
entries: You sprout webbed limbs instead of your normal ones, granting you a swimming speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wings
entries: You sprout wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Barrel Roll
entries: If another creature is attacking you while you are moving through the air, you can use your reaction to add your Dexterity modifier to your AC.

optionalfeature.name: Flyby
entries: While flying, you can use the disengage action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Safe Landing
entries: When you fall and hit the ground, you only take half the damage from falling.

optionalfeature.name: Strong Wings
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked {@condition prone} while you are airborne.

optionalfeature.name: Air Shield
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet of you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use use your reaction to spend 1 Gust Point to deflect the missile. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d6} + your Dexterity modifier + your fighter level.
For every Gust Point you spend on this feature, the damage from the attack is reduced by an additional {@dice 1d4}.

optionalfeature.name: Hurricane Ward
entries: You can use a bonus action to spend a Gust Point to create a 10-foot wide and 10-foot tall pillar of strong wind (20 miles per hour) in an area within 30 feet of you. The wind has the effects of the {@spell Warding Wind} spell. The wind disperses at the start of your next turn.
For every additional Gust Point you spend on this feature, the pillar of strong wind grows 10 feet wider and higher.

optionalfeature.name: Updraft
entries: When you hit a medium or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 2 Gust Points to create a strong Updraft below the creature. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Typhoons Champion save DC. On a success, the creature is unaffected. On a failed save, the creature is lifted 10 feet straight up into the air. If the creature is airborne and fails its save, it is lifted up 10 feets higher and falls {@condition prone}.
If you spend an additional Gust Point, you can use this ability on a Large creature.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Burst
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 Gust Point to create a strong burst of wind in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide directly in front of you. Each creature in that line must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Typhoons Champion save DC, being moved back 20 feet. For every additional Gust Point you use on this feature, the distance of the line grows by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Wall
entries: You can use an action to spend 3 Gust Point to Cast the Wind Wall spell. The Wall disperses at the start of your next turn.
For every additional Gust Point you spend on this feature, an additional round is added to the Wind Walls duration.

optionalfeature.name: Leeching Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell that targets a single creature, you can spend 3 sorcery points to regain hit points equal to half the amount of damage dealt, to a maximum amount of half of your total hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Maw
entries: The pact with your patron transforms your esophagus into the entrance to a demiplane, called the maw. When swallowing an item or creature you can use a bonus action to open the gateway to the maw. Anything you swallow while the entrance is open is transported to a sphere roughly 10 feet in diameter. No matter what's inside the maw, your weight doesn't increase. You can only place a creature or item inside the maw if you are physically able to fit it in your mouth. You do not take damage when swallowing something while the gateway to the maw is open.

Additionally, you can use an action to enlarge your mouth to swallow something you otherwise couldn't. If the target is an object, it can't be larger than 5 feet in all dimensions. If the target is a creature, it has to be medium or smaller and you have to make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature is transported to the maw.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

A creature inside the maw can make a Strength check against your spellcasting modifier at the start of each of its turns to break free. If it succeeds, you regurgitate the creature in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You can close the gateway to the maw as a free action.

If an extradimensional space created by a bag of holding, Heward's handy haversack, portable hole or similar item is placed inside your maw, it destroys the item immediately and a gate to the Astral Plane is opened in your space. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

trait.name: Spider Climb (Spider only)
entries: The drone can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pincer (Beetle only)
entries: {@atk mw} + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d8} + your Wisdom modifier bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Charge (11th level; Beetle only)
entries: The drone immediately moves 20 feet in a straight line in a direction you choose. If the drone passes through a creature's space, the creature has to succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sting (Wasp only)
entries: {@atk mw} + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 2d8} + your Wisdom modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Stinger Shot (11th level; Wasp only)
entries: {@atk rw} + your Proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier, range 60 ft., one creature: {@h}{@damage 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Web Shot (Spider only)
entries: Choose a creature within 30 feet of the drone. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, or be {@condition restrained} by a sticky web for the next minute. As an action on each of its turns, a {@condition restrained} creature can make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC to break free.

action.name: Climbing Web. (11th level; Spider only)
entries: The drone spins a web on a horizontal or vertical surface in a 30-foot circle centered on the drone. Any creature moving across the webbed surface is unaffected by difficult terrain and can climb vertical surfaces using their movement speed without making an ability check.

action.name: Cloud of Vitality (Fly only)
entries: The drone explodes in a shower of green mist. The drone is reduced to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it is healed by {@dice 1d8} + your Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Cloud of Restoration (11th level; Fly only)
entries: The drone explodes in a shower of blue mist. The drone is reduced to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it that is either {@condition blinded}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, or {@condition poisoned} is cured of these conditions.

feat.name: Adamantine Chitin
entries: Your shell has become as strong as adamant, unable to be pierced by even the mightiest of attacks. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC

When you suffer a critical hit, you can use your reaction to turn that attack into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Amphibious
entries: You are one of the few Chilopodians that moves through water as quickly as on land. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a swimming speed of 20 feet.
You can hold your breath for up to 30 minutes at a time.

feat.name: Blind Spot
entries: You evolved some psionic capabilities, seldomly seen in Warrior. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can choose a creature within 30 feet of you to make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the creature perceives you as if you were invisible for 1 minute. Should the creature have special senses which allows it to see invisible creatures, such as blindsight, you still appear invisible to it. If the creature takes damage from you, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. You have to finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

feat.name: Burning Blade
entries: You further master the destructive fire magic of your people. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell flame blade} spell, and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast the spell in this way when you finish a long rest. Additionally, you can recast the spell by spending a 2nd-level spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.
When you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1.

feat.name: Charge
entries: Your mighty horn grows even larger, making goring rushing extremely dangerous for anyone on the other site of its pointy end. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you move at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hit it with a horn attack on the same turn, the creature takes an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage. If the target is no more than one size larger than you, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

feat.name: Crushing Grip
entries: The power of your grapple is able to crush the bones of your enemies with ease. You gain the following benefits:

items: While reared up, you can grapple a creature while both of your hands are occupied, using your body to coil around the creature. You can't go out of your reared up state while you are grappling a creature in this way.
On the start of each of their turns, a creature grappled by you takes {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage.

feat.name: Cold Refusal
entries: Your crystal carapace is coated in frigid ice. You gain the following benefits:

items: At the end of a long rest, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.

feat.name: Death Chirp
entries: You can emit a high pitched sound that is disorienting for other creatures. You can force a creature within 10 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Descendant of the Damned
entries: Wandering the sands of your ancestors and viewing the deaths of many, your Scion blood sings the songs of those beyond. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your unarmed strikes made with your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
You gain resistance to necrotic damage.

feat.name: Glimmering Magic
entries: You aquire a knowledge of the magic of the mystical feywild, granted through the Archfey patron of your tribe. You learn the {@spell faerie fire} spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell phantasmal force} and {@spell blink}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Hard to Kill
entries: As a Roach you've survived through most of the hardships the world could throw at you, becoming even harder to kill. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you succeed on three death saving throws, you regain 1 hit point and become conscious. You also gain the benefits of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.
When you fail a death saving throw, you can choose to reroll the saving throw. You must use the new roll. Once you use this feature you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Mark of the Wurm
entries: You have been touched by the dark god itself, giving you the ability to cast more of its destructive magic. You learn the {@spell toll the dead|xge} spell and can cast it at will. You also learn {@spell bane} and {@spell ray of enfeeblement}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

feat.name: Master Waxcrafter
entries: Bumbles are masters of sculpting and using wax in all sorts of different ways. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item Forgery kit|phb}. Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you gain 1 clump of wax. You can create additional clumps of wax by spending 1 gp and 1 hour of uninterrupted work.

Additionally, you can use 1 clump of wax and apply it to yourself or another creature. It takes you 10 minutes to apply the wax. After the application is completed, the creature gains resistance to cold and lightning damage for one hour.

feat.name: Mind's Eye
entries: Your psionic powers grow ever stronger as your mind is expanding. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you cast the {@spell mage hand} cantrip using your psionic powers trait, the hand is invisible.

You gain expertise in the Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. If you aren't already proficient in the Wisdom (Insight) skill, you gain proficiency with it. Should the skill already benefit from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus, your proficiency bonus is only doubled once.

feat.name: Mystic Evasion
entries: The glimmering veil of the Feywild quickens your flight and misdirects attackers. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain advantage on saving throws against falling {@condition prone} while flying.

When you are hit by a ranged attack while flying, you can use your reaction to make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to the attack roll made against you. On a success, you avoid the attack and take no damage. On a failure, the attack hits you like normal. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Reach
entries: You are impressively long-limbed. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

feat.name: Royal Authority
entries: You are a leader by nature and your voice and stature makes that clear to everyone. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) skill. If you are already proficient in it, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with it.

As an action, you can let your voice boon to confirm your superiority. Each creature of your choice within 30 ft. of you has to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. If the {@condition frightened} target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Shining Star
entries: Your intuition always leads you safely back home. You gain the following benefits:

items: Traveling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score.

You can create a guiding light that leads you to your destination. If you concentrate on a location you have been to on the same plane of existence, you can create a floating globe of light that leads you along the most direct physical path to the specified location. The light can't lead you to a destination on another plane of existence, a destination that moves, or a destination you haven't personally been at. You have to concentrate on the light as if it were a spell and it vanishes after 1 day or if you loose concentration.

feat.name: Song of Summer
entries: You learn the the ways of the summer court of the fey, channeling their magic in a uprising melody. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to fire damage.

You learn the {@spell bless} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Song of Winter
entries: Your connection to your unseelie ancestors of the winter court deepens, teaching you a haunting melody. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to cold damage.

You learn the {@spell bane} spell a nd can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Spellweaver
entries: Further delving into your fiendish heritage, you have grown in your mastery of their foul magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your legs to perform ths somatic components of a spell. If you are {@condition restrained} you are unable to use this feature
You learn 1 Cantrip from the Warlock spell list. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You know the {@condition web} spell and Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for it. Once you cast this spell through this feature, you need to finish a long rest before you can do so again.

feat.name: Teamwork
entries: You excel at lending your allies a helping hand. You gain the following benefits:

items: When a creature within 5 feet of you has to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant them the benefits of the help action on that roll.
When you use the help action to aid a creature with an ability check or attack role, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll.

feat.name: Terminal Velocity
entries: Your flying speed and ferocity with your stinger are unparalleled. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your flying speed increases to 20 feet, or 40 feet if you are 5th level or above.
Immediately after you use the Dash action on your turn while flying and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your stinger as a bonus action.

feat.name: Vicious Feast
entries: You relish in the taste of battle. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make an unarmed strike with your Bite attack or reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can spend one Hit Dice to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Winged
entries: You sproute translucent wings. With your wings, you have a flying speed of 20 feet if you aren't wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Gore
entries: Your horn is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier. Additionally, if you take the Dash action and end your turn within 5 feet of a target, you may make a horn attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Rhinoceros Beetle
entries: Rhinoceros Beetles are quite a bit stronger than other beetles. In their society, having the largest horn is seen as beautiful and the males tend to be very eager to show their worth in battle. They even tend to pick fights with Insectoids double their size.

entries.name: Extra Arms
entries: You have two secondary appendages that are weaker than your primary ones. You can not effectively wield a weapon or brace a shield with these. However, you can use them to perform the somatic components of spells and hold and use items.

entries.name: Born Climbers
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your base walking speed. Additionally, you can carry a creature of medium size or smaller without any disadvantages on your speed while climbing.

entries.name: Harlequin Beetle
entries: Harlequin beetles are more agile than other beetlefolk. They tend to be a bit more reserved, but nontheless very pleasant bugs.

entries.name: Powerful Pincers
entries: Stag Beetles can use their powerful Pincers to grapple their foes. You gain advantage on checks made to grapple creatures or prevent creatures from escaping your grapple. Additionally, you count as one size larger for the purpose of grappling.

entries.name: Stag Beetle
entries: Stag beetles are the sturdiest and most resilient of beetlekind. Like their Rhinoceros cousins they tend to work as reliable soldiers in many armies. However, Stag beetles are less aggressive and rather try to get a lot of attention through jokes and loudmouthed behaviour.

entries.name: Wings
entries: You don't take damage from falling and always land on your feet. Should you be knocked prone, have your speed reduced to 0, or are otherwise deprived of the ability to move before you land, you take damage equal to the total distance you fell.

entries.name: Fluorescent Body
entries: As a bonus action, you can make your abdomen shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. You can dim the light using another bonus action.

Additionally, using an action you can let your fluorescent organ flare up in a flash of light. Every creature in a 5 foot radius is blinded until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Firefly
entries: Fireflies are adventurous people. They're usually nomads, explorers, treasure hunters, cartographers and historians. Their ability to generate light and warmth makes them extremely capable of exploring unknown places of all kinds. From caves to swamps, forests to mountains, old ruins and ancient hives. Fireflies are alway on the go, never settling anywhere for too long.

entries.name: Mystical Stridulation
entries: Your legs count as a spellcasting focus, and you can replace vocal components with sounds emitted from it. In addition, you know one Bard cantrip of your choice. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Performer's Intuition
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Charisma ({@skill Deception}) skill check, you can add 1d4 to your roll.

entries.name: Cricket
entries: They say there's no better entertainment than a cricket in a tavern. Those who do have seen these cheerful and open figures fill the room with music and cheer. Having long since left the Evergreen Forest where their rustic kin reside, crickets seek to enjoy life's pleasures one day at a time, with no regard for the past or future.

entries.name: Cold Hardened
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Prowler's Intuition
entries: When you make a {@skill Stealth} or {@skill Survival} check, you can add {@dice 1d4} to the roll.

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you can't understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

entries.name: Locust
entries: Dwelling in the distant wilds are the locusts, skilled hunters and guardians of the wilderness. Armed with bow and blade, these reclusive individuals claim to keep neutrality and focus in their own lands. Naturally connected to the creatures of the wild, locusts travel through the branches with astounding speed before bringing their prey down with a barrage of arrows.

entries.name: Accomplished Burrowers
entries: You gain a burrowing speed of 20 feet. You can only burrow through dirt or ground of similar density.

entries.name: Underground Architects
entries: You gain proficiency with mason's tools. Additionally, whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of tunnels and structures underground, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal.

entries.name: Bull Ant
entries: As a Bull Ant, you are born into a society of ambitious, hardworking and skillful individuals. Bull Ants are amazing architects, artisans and builders. Their cities are massive and their tunnels ever expanding. Bull Ant society is very loyal to their Queen and great allies of the Royal Hexagon. Their soldiers make up a the largest part of troops in the royal army.

entries.name: Crystal Carapace
entries: Your carapace is hard like diamond and adapt to cold climates. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
Furthermore, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Frost Ant
entries: As a frost ant you are born into the ant hill of the Northern Star. You are resilient, one of the only Insectoids able to live in the arctic regions of Insectopia. Your crystalline carapace evolved to protect you from even the harshest environments and icy cold winds.

entries.name: Fiery Souls
entries: You know the {@spell control flames|xge} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell burning hands|phb} spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell scorching ray|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Fire Ant
entries: As a fire ant you are a ferocious warrior with an innate proficiency for destructive fire magic. Fire Ants are a group of Formicoids that split off from the Royal Hexagon. They may not be sworn enemies to the Royal Hexagon, however their society is based on war and battle and as such conflict with the Red Empire is almost inevitable. As for all Formicoids, it is a very rare occasion that a Fire Ant leaves its hive, but such adventureres are highly searched for by militaries and marauding tribes across the Bug World.

entries.name: Silent Predators
entries: You gain advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while you are standing still.

entries.name: Reflective Grapple
entries: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, you can attempt to grapple the creature instead of dealing damage.

entries.name: Warrior Mantis
entries: The male Warrior Mantis are shorter than their female counterparts, but make up for it with increased strength and reflexes. Their chitin comes in natural colors, from different shades of green to brown, making it easy for them to vanish into the foliage. As a Warrior Mantis you belong to a cast of mighty warriors, defending their clans with skill and might.

entries.name: Mind Shielding
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence saving throws.

entries.name: Psionic Powers
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand|phb} cantrip. When you reach level 3 you can cast the {@spell charm person|phb} spell once, and can't do so again until you finish a long rest. When you reach level 5 you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts|phb} spell once, and can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Orchid Mantis
entries: The female Orchid Mantis are tall, long-lived, and beautiful creatures, their chitin shillering in shades of pink and white. If you choose this subrace, you belong to the ruling cast of the Mantis, leading their respective clans through their psychic connections with unrivaled authority.

entries.name: Pheromonal Telepathy
entries: You can create a telepathic link to one willing creature, using your pheromones. For the next 10 minutes, you can talk to the creature telepathically, while you are wihtin 120 feet of them. You can't use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Swarm Intelligence
entries: When an ally within 10 ft. of you has to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to give them an additional {@dice 1d4} to the roll.

entries.name: Soothing Honey
entries: Using a bonus action, you can produce one portion of honey, which can be ingested to heal {@dice 1d4} + half your level (rounded up) hit points. You can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Bee
entries: Bees make up the largest part of the Vespoid population. They make up the diligent workforce and soldiers of the Royal Hexagon. Bees are wise individual and show a lot of care towards their allies. They can use pheromones to telepathically communicate with each other and work best in a swarm.

entries.name: Slow Fliers
entries: Bumbles are slower than other Vespoids, because of their bulky stature. Your flying speed is 10 feet at 1st level and increases to 20 feet at 5th.
Furthermore, you do not need to land at the end of your turn when flying in a strong wind.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Bumbles are bigger than other Vespoids, ranging from 8 to 9 feet. Your are considered to be one size larger when determining carrying capacity.

entries.name: Waxbuilders
entries: Bumbles are masters of sculpting and using wax in all sorts of different ways. You gain proficiency with one {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Bumble Hulk
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by {@dice 1d4}, and it increases by {@dice 1d4} every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Bumble
entries: Bumbles are the powerhouses of the Vespoids. Much larger and bulkier than their bee cousins, Bumbles are often employed in the military or protect the queens as bodyguards. They are also very adept in working with wax and paper, making them excelent forgers of papers and documents.

entries.name: Poison Adepts
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}.

entries.name: Deadly Stinger
entries: Your stinger is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes made with your stinger.

entries.name: Hidden Flight
entries: You gain advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while flying.

entries.name: Wasp
entries: Long ago one part of the Vespoid swarm splitted off and left for the Dark Woods. Those Vespoids later became what is now known as Wasps. Wasps vary greatly from their Vespoid brethren, only their yellow and black stripes signaling some kind of relation between them. They have smooth chitin plates instead of fur, they are slender and tall and their feature seems more jagged. They have a poisonous spike they use to attack. Most wasps are live solidarly or in small families. They are cunning and intelligent creatures, though they are also quite aggressive, making them dangerous for other bugs. Only few criminal organizations, like the Black Leaf, employ Wasps, due to their uncontrolable temper.
